diagnosis.final_diagnosis: X-linked Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 1X with associated chronic progressive demyelinating CNS disease and characteristics satisfying the diagnostic criteria for primary progressive multiple sclerosis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with CNS involvement as indicated by symptoms such as gait ataxia, dysphagia, and dysarthria, along with MRI findings showing multiple T2-hyperintense lesions and Gd-enhancing lesions in the pons, fulfilling the criteria for MS. The detection of the mutation in the GJB1 gene further supports the association with CMT1X.
